definition: echelon (military)/(of an organisation) group of persons of one level or grade

sentences.english: The army was echeloned along the river.
His brother Corry is captain of United's Academy side.
sentences.chinese: 他的弟弟克里則是曼聯梯隊的隊長。

sentences.english: Then there are the smaller possibilities.
sentences.chinese: 下面是可能性稍小的第二梯隊。

sentences.english: To arrange or take place in an echelon.
sentences.chinese: 美國可能減少對第三梯隊的國家的援助。

sentences.english: Two battalions assembled foot two-tier stand.
sentences.chinese: 二營爲二梯隊集結山腳待命。

sentences.english: All extraordinary registrations will be automatically assigned at the second division.
sentences.chinese: 所有新登記團隊都將被自動分配到第二梯隊。

sentences.english: In fact, he might gain a voice in shaping the next class of upper-echelon leaders.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，他可能有力量塑造下一梯隊領導人。

sentences.english: Countries in tier three face possible cuts in[ the] American assistance[ assistants].
sentences.chinese: 美國可能減少對第三梯隊的國家的援助。
二是隊伍結構形成梯隊。

sentences.english: The first is mostly made up of the survivors of the 2008 race. Former Govs.
sentences.chinese: 第一梯隊主要由2008年競選中的倖存者構成。

sentences.english: Was there a “second team” of gunmen involved?
sentences.chinese: 有沒有“第二梯隊”的槍手卷入？

sentences.english: And Group 3 covers some local brands.
sentences.chinese: 第三梯隊是一些地方品牌。

sentences.english: I am very sad, but I can not incriminate echelon.
sentences.chinese: 我很傷心，但是我不能連累梯隊。
